nbodypy.community.limepy.limepy package¶

Submodules¶

nbodypy.community.limepy.limepy.limepy module¶

class nbodypy.community.limepy.limepy.limepy.limepy(phi0, g, **kwargs)¶

Bases: object

df(*arg)¶

Returns the value of the normalised DF at a given position in phase space, can only be called after solving Poisson’s equation

Arguments can be:

  • r, v (isotropic single-mass models)

  • r, v, j (isotropic multi-mass models)

  • r, v, theta, j (anisotropic models)

  • x, y, z, vx, vy, vz, j (all models)

Here j specifies the mass bin, j=0 for single mass Works with scalar and array input

get_Paz(az_data, R_data, jns)¶

Computes probability of line of sight acceleration at projected R : P(az|R)

interp_phi(r)¶

Returns interpolated potential at r, works on scalar and arrays

legendre_Ul(l, theta)¶
